channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2023100792
item.description:
Report E-2023100792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he went into the store to obtain a veeder reading. Driver did state, the load amount was 3000 gallons per delmo but dialed it back. Driver stated at first, he didn’t stick diesel tank but stuck the gas drop. Then he mentioned stick was broke and couldn’t get an accurate amount in diesel tank and mentioned he did stick the tank. Driver states he started dropping diesel and then hooked up Unleaded and started to drop it also. Driver observed diesel not flowing and started gas while trying to figure out problem with diesel. Driver had to stop diesel flow several times to allow tank to breathe and lifted drop gun off fitting in ground allowing it to drain down. Driver completed unleaded drop and was clearing hose when he seen product coming from drop. Driver cleaned up with spill pads. Driver reported to store but left scene with cones around spill to later return and put down oil dry to finish cleanup.

item.title: Report E-2023100752
item.description:
Report E-2023100752

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN2810 "07347A Durez Liquid One Step Phenolic Resin" release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of material released to a 6’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to the pallet collapsing. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. They were then collected into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100129
item.description:
Report X-2023100129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: upon getting pkg it was removed from belt, and place in QA area. QA inspected hazmat and started the damaged report process. DescribePack: The failure was that the cap on one of the items was not screw tightly enough, which has caused internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To mitigate the effects, QA secured the package by screwing the cap tightly.

item.title: Report X-2023100119
item.description:
Report X-2023100119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100119 SequenceEvent: Found package leaking contents in unload, we put proper PPE Gloves, and placed box in a plastic container with liner. Upon inspecting, 2 bottles had loose caps leaking out contents. DescribePack: Lids failed as they were loose on the bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Secured boxes in a plastic container with liner. 2. X-2023100120 SequenceEvent: Found package leaking contents in unload, we put proper PPE Gloves, and placed box in a plastic container with liner. Upon inspecting, 2 bottles had loose caps leaking out contents. DescribePack: Lids failed as they were loose on the bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Secured boxes in a plastic container with liner. 3. X-2023100121 SequenceEvent: Found package leaking contents in unload, we put proper PPE Gloves, and placed box in a plastic container with liner. Upon inspecting, 2 bottles had loose caps leaking out contents. DescribePack: Lids failed as they were loose on the bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Secured boxes in a plastic container with liner.

item.description:

  • City: DALLAS

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE UNKNOWN. AT TIME OF DISCOVERY, HAZMAT TECH WAS CALLED TO REMOVE PACKAGE FROM DOCK AREA. DescribePack: THE SCREW ON CAP BECAME LOOSE FROM CONTAINER AND DRY CONTENTS SPILLED OUT ON ENTIRE CONTENTS OF PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN HAZ-BAG AND TAKEN TO HWSA BY TECHNICIAN. TECHNICIAN RETURNED TO CLEAN UP SPILLED CONTENTS.

item.title: Report X-2023090479
item.description:
Report X-2023090479

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PADDED EXPRESS PACKAGE GOING TO SINGAPORE THAT WAS EMITTING A STRONG FUEL ODOR. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY AN 8 OUNCE FUEL SAMPLE IN A 12 OUNCE BOTTLE. THE SAMPLE HAD RELEASED ENOUGH FUEL VAPORS TO REMOVE THE LABEL FROM THE SAMPLE AND DAMPEN THE INNER PACKAGING. INNER DOCUMENTATION CONTAINED AN SDS SHOWING THE PRODUCT TO BE REGULATED AS DIESEL FUEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2023100475
item.description:
Report E-2023100475

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T18:14:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: BROWNSVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AFTER PRODUCT UNLOADED DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO DISCONNECT HOSE BEFORE DEPRESSURIZING HOSE. PRODUCT IN HOSE SPRAYED OUT AND ONTO DRIVER WHO WAS NOT WEARING REQUIRED PPE. DRIVER RINSED OFF AND COMPLETED DISCONNECTING HOSES. DRIVER FAILED TO REPORT INCIDENT AT TIME AND WENT HOME AFTER SHIFT. NEXT DAY DRIVER SOUGHT MEDICAL ATTENTION FOR REACTION ON SKIN. DRIVER HOSPITALIZED FOR SEVERAL DAYS THEN RELEASED FROM HOSPITAL.

item.title: Report I-2023090023
item.description:
Report I-2023090023

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/10/2023, an unapproved oxygen bottle was transported undeclared on DL1515 (arrived in DFW). The oxygen bottle was found to be inside of the pouch that was attached to a passengers' assistive device. The check valve of the oxygen bottle was attached to the unit. The DFW supervisor observed the oxygen bottle upon taking the assistive device to the jet way. See the attached picture.

item.title: Report I-2023090119
item.description:
Report I-2023090119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: ARMSTRONG
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AmeriGas vehicle traveling northbound on Hwy 77 at posted speed. Third party vehicle rear ended AmeriGas vehicle causing third party vehicle to be totaled. Due to impact, AmeriGas rear deck piping ripped or torn causing release of propane. Responding HazMat team was able to make safe releasing product and vehicles were towed from scene.
